name: excursus

a detailed discussion or explanation of a subject, which is separate from the main subject that is being written or talked about: Before discussing this a short historical excursus will be necessary to explain how it all came about. The case histories include an 11-page excursus on Latin.
More examplesFewer examplesThere is a 14 page excursus to chapter 10 which directly discusses several "difficult texts." The Marquis de Valady is a little-known participant in the French Revolution whose vegetarianism leads the author into an extended excursus on the bloody internecine struggles of that momentous event. We hope that this short excursus into the Christian mind shows why freedom matters so much to us.
